title: Fastest Street-Legal Car In Video Of Bengaluru Tycoon Who Died By Suicide
content: A property tycoon and chairman of a Bengaluru-headquartered real estate firm who died by suicide today owned the world's fastest road-legal car, the Bugatti Veyron.

title: "Love Should Not Be Toxic, Even For Languages": Kamal Haasan On Hindi Row
content: Kamal Haasan underlined that language is just a communication device and when it comes to him, "it's my feeling, it's my expression and it's me".

title: Gurugram Man Strangles Wife Over Domestic Dispute, Flees: Cops
content: A man allegedly strangled his wife to death in their rented accommodation in Khandsa village here following a quarrel, police said on Friday.

title: No Death Penalty For Luigi Mangione In UnitedHealth CEO Murder Case
content: A New York federal judge on Friday dismissed murder and weapons charges against alleged UnitedHealthcare CEO killer Luigi Mangione, a major blow to prosecutors that means Mangione no longer faces a possible death penalty if convicted.

title: Centre Misusing Investigative Agencies And Governors: Udhayanidhi Stalin
content: Attacking the BJP for trying to "impose" Hindi through the National Education Policy, Tamil Nadu Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin has said the DMK will continue to raise its voice against the move.

title: Cuban President Slams US Plan To 'Suffocate' Island's Economy
content: Cuban President Miguel Diaz-Canel on Friday denounced what he called an attempt by US President Donald Trump to "suffocate" the communist island's economy with new tariffs.

title: Ex-CNN Host Don Lemon Arrested Over Minnesota Anti-ICE Protests
content: Former CNN anchor Don Lemon, now an independent journalist, has been arrested for alleged involvement in an "coordinated attack" on a church during protests in Minnesota against an immigration crackdown, the US attorney general said Friday.

title: Israel To Partially Open Rafah Crossing On Feb 1
content: Israel announced it would reopen the crucial Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt on Sunday after months of urging from the UN, humanitarian organisations and ordinary Palestinians -- but only for the "limited movement of people".

title: Committee Blames Digital Espionage For 2025 Peace Prize Winner Leak
content: Digital espionage was likely to have been behind the uncovering of the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize winner's name ahead of its official release, the Norwegian Nobel Committee said.

title: UP Man Gets 20-Year Jail Term For Raping 11-Year-Old Girl In 2020
content: A court here sentenced a man to 20 years of imprisonment for raping an 11-year-old girl in 2020, the police said.

title: Fire-Hit Kolkata Warehouse Was Sub-Let To Momo Chain: Police
content: A senior police official investigating the devastating fire near Kolkata that claimed over 20 lives told NDTV, the possibility of extracting any more remains from the destroyed site is over as rescue and search ops are to be closed tomorrow.

title: College Student, 19, Dies After Truck Hits Her Bicycle In UP: Cops
content: A BA second-year student was killed on Friday after a truck hit her bicycle from behind here, police said.

title: Iran Ready For 'Fair' Talk With US But Defence Capabilities Not On Table
content: Iran is prepared for the resumption of talks with the United States, but they should be fair and not include Iran's defence capabilities, Iran's chief diplomat said on Friday, as regional powers work to prevent military conflict between the two foes.

title: Parties In Fierce Debate On X Factor In Tamil Nadu Election
content: The spokespersons of four major parties had a fierce debate today on what could be the X factor in the Tamil Nadu assembly election. At the NDTV Tamil Nadu Summit, convenor of the state BJP's coordination committee, H Raja, fired the first shot.

title: Bengaluru Real Estate Tycoon, Under Tax Scrutiny, Dies By Suicide In Office
content: A prominent real estate developer, the Confident Group has a significant presence across several southern Indian states, most notably Kerala and Karnataka.

title: Video: Speeding SUV Hits Electricity Pole In Jabalpur, Plunges Area Into Darkness
content: A driver lost control of his SUV at a high speed in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Friday morning, hitting an electricity pole and plunging an entire locality into darkness for some time.

title: Inside The Ming Clan: A Family Built A Scam Empire And Paid With Their Lives
content: Eleven members of the Ming family criminal gang, who ran mafia-like scam centres in Myanmar, have been executed by China, state media reported on Thursday.

title: Buddha Relics Come Home After 127 Years: Inside India's Mission In Hong Kong
content: In a moment being described as civilisationally historic, sacred relics of Lord Gautam Buddha excavated from Piprahwa, believed to be the ancient Kapilavastu of the Shakya dynasty, have returned to India after 127 years.

title: 'Crowds Don't Always Mean Votes': Kanimozhi To NDTV On Vijay

title: Bengaluru Techie Mauled By Her Neighbour's Pet Dog, CCTV Captures Horror
content: The dog reportedly attacked without provocation, biting her on the neck. When a man rushed to her rescue, the dog turned on him as well.

title: 2-year Central deputation at SP/DIG level must for IPS officers to be eligible for senior posts: MHA
content: The MHA writes to States that a minimum of two years of Central experience at SP/DIG or equivalent level will be mandatory for empanelment of IPS officers at IG/equivalent level at the Centre from the 2011 batch onwards.

content: Minister says government has extended timeline to 140 days to allow thorough verification, instructs officials to actively involve landowners at every stage and defer surveys if farmers concerned are not present

title: Karnataka bans tobacco-related advertisements on RTC buses after public backlash
content: The decision comes amid growing protests by Kannada activists in Bengaluru and other parts of the state who have recently been removing tobacco-related advertisements from RTC buses.

content: Water flowed through taps in only 83% of households, and only 76% had water that met standards for e-coli, faecal coliform, pH levels

content: Policymakers, industry leaders, designers, economists, accessibility practitioners, and travellers will share the stage on the first day as it will bring together policy intent, expert perspectives, lived experience, and design practice to debate on the central question of what it will take to make tourism truly inclusive.

content: CM says government will support NCP decision; Parth Pawar likely to replace his mother as a Rajya Sabha MP; reunification not a priority, says a group of NCP leaders, even as NCP-SP leaders push for it

content: As a first step, 50 dogs were caught from various areas within the corporationâ€™s borders and sterilised

content: His death coincides with the 20th anniversary of Confident Group, which has completed multiple projects in Kerala, Karnataka, and Dubai, along with several ongoing ventures. The news has left the companyâ€™s staff at its Kochi headquarters devastated

content: The Working Group on Access to Medicines and Treatment said there was no clarity on provisions related to medical treatment or medicine patents and sought the release of the full text of the EU-India Free Trade Agreement

content: The IISc team that has done the study said that its goal is to deploy this method as an alternative, sustainable building strategy, to rely less on carbon-intensive cement-based processes â€” both on Earth and Mars

content: The 56-year-old man had sexually abused the 12-year-old girl at a child care home in Thiruvananthapuram in 2021

title: Three killed as car plunges off bridge, catches fire in Gujarat
content: The bodies have been recovered and sent for forensic examination, while samples have been forwarded to the Forensic Science Laboratory for identification, the police said

title: Sunetra Pawar likely to be NCP leader, dy CM; how CM Fadnavis reacted
content: Maharashtra chief minister Devendra Fadnavis stated that the NCP will decide its next leader following Ajit Pawar's demise, with the government and BJP supporting their choice. Fadnavis will oversee the state budget process, which Pawar was set to present. Reports suggest Sunetra Pawar may succeed her husband as legislative party leader and deputy chief minister.

title: Djokovic stares at history, ends Sinner streak to book AO final spot
content: Novak Djokovic battled past Jannik Sinner in a marathon five-setter, reaching his 11th Australian Open final after a match that stretched past midnight.  The Serbian legend, at 38, is now one win away from an unprecedented 11th title and a record 25th Grand Slam. He faces Carlos Alcaraz in a highly anticipated rematch.

title: Trump thinks giant US winter storm exposed global warming 'con': How he got it completely wrong
content: Chilly weather moments might spark doubt about climate change, but research consistently shows our planet is heating up. Even with brief cold spells, the overall temperature is on the rise, resulting in ice melt, higher sea levels, and erratic weather patterns. The primary culprits? Our reliance on fossil fuels.

title: B'luru real estate tycoon found dead: Cops suspect suicide; I-T had raided his office
content: Real estate magnate CJ Roy, founder of Confident Group, was discovered deceased at his Bengaluru office on Friday, sustaining bullet injuries from his licensed firearm. Authorities suspect suicide, with the final cause of death pending a post-mortem examination. The incident occurred shortly after the Income Tax Department reportedly conducted searches at his premises.

title: Demis Hassabis gives credit to OpenAI for scaling tech that Google researchers created
content: Google DeepMind's CEO Demis Hassabis admits the company was slow to commercialise its foundational AI technology, allowing rivals like OpenAI to scale chatbots effectively.  He emphasised a shift towards a scrappier, faster approach, with DeepMind now serving as the 'engine room' for Google's AI product launches amidst intense competition.

title: The extra Test: When four pitches were used for 4 innings in a match
content: England's 1882 cricket loss at The Oval sparked a mock obituary and the quest to regain The Ashes. The subsequent tour saw a unique Test match played on four separate wickets. This experiment, never repeated, highlights early cricket's willingness to innovate. The Ashes, a small urn, became a symbol of this rivalry.

title: Sunetra Pawar to be named NCP leader, to take oath as Maha dy CM tomorrow: Chhagan Bhujbal
content: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) will convene a legislature party meeting on January 31 to name Sunetra Pawar, wife of late deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar, as its leader. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has indicated no objection to Sunetra Pawar taking oath as deputy chief minister as early as Saturday, pending the formal decision.

title: Magh Mela row: Seer ups the ante, makes 2 big demands; asks CM to prove he is 'Hindu sympathiser'
content: Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati has asked UP CM  Yogi Adityanath to stop beef exports from the state and declare the cow as â€˜Rajya Mataâ€™. He emphasized that such steps would prove the chief ministerâ€™s commitment as a â€œHindu sympathiserâ€. The seer further stated that  he had staged a sit-in protest for 11 days after the incident but left the Magh Mela ground last Wednesday â€œwith a heavy heartâ€.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook answers why Google, not Sam Altman's OpenAI, won the race for Siri
content: Apple has chosen Google's advanced Gemini AI for its new Siri and upcoming Apple Intelligence features, prioritizing superior technology over OpenAI. CEO Tim Cook emphasized this collaboration, assuring users of continued privacy standards. While OpenAI's ChatGPT integration remains, it's now seen as secondary. Apple views this AI integration as a significant value creator and potential revenue stream.

title: Your urine could signal danger: Doctor explains what to watch for
content: Your urine offers vital health insights, acting as a window into your body's internal workings. Doctors can detect kidney issues, infections, diabetes, and even potential cancers through simple urine tests. Abnormalities like unusual color, smell, froth, or the presence of blood, sugar, or crystals can signal various health concerns requiring prompt medical attention and further examination.

title: Maharashtra Pawar play: NCP factions eyeing February merger?
content: Ajit Pawar's untimely death in a plane crash has reignited talks of reuniting the NCP factions. Sources indicate merger talks were advanced, with Ajit Pawar viewing it as a strategic move for the party's future. His passing may now accelerate this process, with a potential February announcement. Leadership questions arise for the ruling NCP.

title: Google co-founder Sergey Brin makes his largest single public donation ever
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has made his largest public donation, contributing $20 million to a new coalition, 'Building a Better California,' to address the state's housing crisis. This significant contribution makes him the anchor donor for a $35 million launch package, joined by other tech leaders. The donation occurs as California billionaires prepare for a potential wealth tax initiative.

title: 'Nothing more to say': India coach delivers blunt verdict on Sanju Samson
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak affirmed strong belief in Sanju Samson despite a recent dip in form, emphasizing it's a temporary phase. Kotak highlighted the importance of the ongoing series for T20 World Cup preparations and indicated Ishan Kishan's likely return for the final match. He also praised Abhishek Sharma's fundamentals and Suryakumar Yadav's return to form.

title: Budget 2026 I-T: Top expectations of salaried taxpayers, households
content: Households may also look for targeted relief at the lower end of the income spectrum. Under the new tax regime, the current rebate ensures that individuals with income up to Rs 12 lakh face no tax liability. For salaried taxpayers, the Rs 75,000 standard deduction effectively extends this relief to those with gross income up to Rs 12.75 lakh.

title: Thierry Henry and Andrea Rajacic net worth, wealth and love story
content: Thierry Henry became a football legend with clubs like Arsenal and Barcelona, then stayed in the game as a coach and TV expert. By early 2026, his net worth is estimated around $125â€“135 million. His long-time partner Andrea Rajacic, who works in fashion, has her own income. Together, they share a quiet family life and a combin

title: MLB trade rumors: Braves eye $35M Cubs star as Robert Suarez emerges key asset
content: A hypothetical trade sees the Atlanta Braves acquiring versatile infielder Nico Hoerner from the Chicago Cubs for hard-throwing reliever Robert Suarez. This move addresses Atlanta's infield void due to injury, while Chicago secures a much-needed closer. Both players are in their prime with multi-year control, making it a balanced, win-now exchange.

title: 'I needed to let him go': Gabrielle Union on almost ending marriage with Dwyane Wade
content: Dwyane Wade and his wife, the popular actress Gabrielle Union, have had a beautiful and a healthy marriage ever since they tied the knot in 2014 after dating for a couple of years. While both Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union had been through divorce before, the popular actress did not have a biological child of her own unlike the NBA legend. As the two tried to expand their family, Gabrielle Union details the trauma she faced as she failed to conceive.

title: Australian Open: The agony of being Zverev in the age of Carlos Alcaraz
content: Most non-athletes wouldnâ€™t last in a cage, ring, or court with a professional. But even amongst professional athletes, thereâ€™s a rare breed that has access to a metaphorical place their less hallowed peers wish they could reach. They operate at a level that even fellow professionals fail to comprehend. Itâ€™s both mental and physical.

title: Blatant lie: Gaurav Gogoi slams Assam CM Himanta Sarma over â€˜Miya Muslimsâ€™ remarks
content: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi has accused Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma of misusing the Supreme Court's name to justify his "Miya Muslims" remarks. Gogoi labelled Sarma's claims as a "blatant lie," asserting the chief minister falsely attributed words to the apex court. He urged the Supreme Court to take cognisance of these remarks.

title: Budget 2026: Why defence spending is back in sharp focus â€” and how experts want the money spent
content: As India's Union Budget approaches, defence spending is under scrutiny. Experts advocate for a substantial, sustained hike in defence capital expenditure, emphasizing domestic manufacturing and technological advancement. While geopolitical tensions necessitate increased spending, the focus must be on strategic calibration rather than indiscriminate increases to bolster national security and industrial capabilities.

title: 'Whitewashing brutal raids': BJP flays Cong over ex-VP Ansari calling Ghazni 'Indian'
content: BJP storngly condemned former Vice President Hamid Ansari for his remarks who called Mahmud Ghazni as an Indian. In a social media post, BJP spokesperson C Kesavan said that the remarks were â€œshockingâ€ and recalled that Ansari had been the Congress-led UPAâ€™s choice for Vice President twice. Shehzad Poonawala, also attacked the Congress party.

title: NFL Pro Bowl 2026: Date, Time, Stadium, Location, and How to Watch
content: Kick streamer Clavicular revealed his January 2026 earnings, showing he made $110,674.67 on Kick. More than 90 percent came from the Kick Creator Incentive Program, not subscriptions or donations. The figures highlight why KCIP has become a major draw for high-visibility streamers seeking higher, view-based payouts.

title: Are engineering graduates back in demand? IT, CSE fuel employability surge in India
content: Indian engineering graduates are seeing a significant boost in employability, reaching 71.5% in 2025, the highest in five years. This turnaround follows a period of recalibration in both education and hiring, with colleges emphasizing practical skills and employers focusing on demonstrable abilities. Emerging tech fields are driving demand, reshaping career paths beyond traditional roles.

title: Russiaâ€“India talks on Su-57: what is on the table, and what the fighter really offers
content: India and Russia are in advanced technical talks for joint production of the Su-57 fifth-generation fighter jet. This potential collaboration, focusing on licensed production of the export variant, revives past discussions. The Su-57 offers impressive maneuverability and long-range weapons, but its stealth capabilities and engine development are key considerations for India's future air combat fleet and indigenous AMCA program.

title: Dhurandhar edited for OTT cut by nine minutes without Aditya Dhar consent
content: The blockbuster film 'Dhurandhar' has faced controversy with its OTT release on Netflix, with fans disappointed by a reportedly censored version. While one report claims Netflix made edits without director approval, another suggests the filmmakers submitted an unaltered version compliant with streamer mandates. Meanwhile, 'Dhurandhar 2' is slated for an Eid 2026 release.

title: 47% for defence, Rs 197 crore expenditure: A look at Indiaâ€™s first Budget in 1947
content: India's budgetary journey began with the first Union Budget presented on November 26, 1947, amidst the trauma of Partition and economic uncertainty. This interim budget focused on relief, rehabilitation, and defence, reflecting the nation's immediate challenges. Today, the Union Budget is a detailed roadmap for a rapidly growing economy, showcasing India's significant economic evolution.

title: BMW X3 30 xDrive M Sport Pro specs revealed: 20-inch wheels, 258 hp & more
content: The SUV retains features offered on other X3 variants, including a 12.3-inch digital instrument display, a 14.9-inch touchscreen infotainment system, a head-up display (HUD), a head-up display, a 15-speaker Harman Kardon audio system, wireless phone charging, a panoramic sunroof, a powered tailgate, powered and ventilated front seats with memory function and more.

title: 'Iâ€™m not going to change my opinion, I love India': US traveller after Mumbai taxi scam
content: An American tourist, Argentina Ariano, was scammed out of â‚¹18,000 by a taxi driver at Mumbai airport. Despite the incident, she expressed her continued love for India and its people. Mumbai Police swiftly arrested the driver, highlighting the importance of traveler vigilance.

title: Cooper Flagg Drops Historic 49, but Tanking Mavs Fall to Hornets
content: Dallas rookie Cooper Flagg shattered the NBA record for most points by a teenager in a season, dropping 49 in a narrow loss to the Hornets.  This historic performance, which also broke a franchise rookie scoring record, showcased Flagg's immense talent despite his team's ongoing struggles.  The Hornets, meanwhile, extended their winning streak.

title: T20 World Cup: ICC reveals umpires for 'crunch' India-Pakistan match in Colombo
content: Nitin Menon will officiate in his fourth T20 World Cup, while Anantha Padmanabhan makes his debut at an ICC event. Menon is set to reach 150 international matches as an on-field umpire. Kumar Dharmasena, a veteran, will also be officiating, having already stood in 37 T20 World Cup matches.

title: 'Menstrual health a Fundamental Right': SC makes landmark ruling - 3 key orders explained
content: The Supreme Court has declared menstrual hygiene a constitutional right under Article 21, mandating free sanitary pads and separate toilets for girls in all schools. This ruling ensures dignity and equality, holding both government and private institutions accountable for compliance. The judgment stems from concerns over "period-shaming" incidents.

title: B'desh polls: US issues security alert; warns of political violence, 'extremist attacks'
content: The US embassy in Bangladesh has issued a security alert for its citizens ahead of the February 12 parliamentary elections, warning of potential political violence and extremist attacks. Americans are advised to remain vigilant, avoid large gatherings, and monitor local news due to anticipated transportation restrictions and a history of pre-election unrest.

title: â€˜Personal requestâ€™: Moscow agrees to Trump's call to pause Kyiv strikes until Feb 1
content: Moscow has agreed to a one-week pause in strikes on Kyiv, until February 1, following a personal request from US President Donald Trump. The Kremlin stated the move aims to facilitate negotiations, while Trump cited extreme cold as his reason. Ukraine's President Zelenskyy welcomed the announcement, pledging reciprocal restraint if Russia refrains from attacking energy infrastructure.

title: Maxx Crosby Shares Honest Take on Seahawks WR Jaxon Smith-Njigba
content: Maxx Crosby favors Sam Darnold over Drake Maye, praising Jaxon Smith-Njigba's explosive 2025 season.  The Seahawks' front office recognized Smith-Njigba's talent, leading to DK Metcalf's trade to Pittsburgh and Tyler Lockett's move to Tennessee. Lockett later sought release from the Titans and is slated to join Crosby's Raiders in 2026.

title: Jana Nayagan censor row as CBFC moves Supreme Court release delayed
content: The CBFC has approached the Supreme Court regarding the censor row for Thalapathy Vijay's film 'Jana Nayagan', pushing its release further. After a single judge favored producers for immediate certification, the CBFC challenged this, leading the Madras High Court's division bench to order a fresh hearing. The film's release is now entirely dependent on court outcomes.

title: Kolkata godown fire: PM Modi condoles deaths in Anandapur mishap; announces Rs 2 lakh ex-gratia
content: A devastating fire in Kolkata's Anandapur area has claimed at least 11 lives, with many still missing. Prime Minister Modi announced ex-gratia payments for victims. Investigations reveal potential fire safety lapses at the godowns, with authorities probing the exact cause and legal action planned against owners. Relatives anxiously await news.

title: Visa mistakes: I selected 'wrong' Korea in US visa form and this is happened
content: A routine US visa renewal turned into an unexpected interview for one applicant due to a simple dropdown menu error. Mistaking South Korea for North Korea in the application led to a 'refused' status and a mandatory embassy visit. The mix-up, common due to similar country names, was clarified, resulting in visa approval, highlighting the importance of meticulous form completion.

title: India's coach offered to resign after senior player's exclusion over 'indiscipline'
content: Chief coach Craig Fulton reportedly threatened to resign over Manpreet Singh's exclusion from core hockey probables on disciplinary grounds, viewing it as "external interference." Fulton advocated for the veteran midfielder's inclusion, citing his fitness and mentorship role. Hockey India officials, however, maintained Manpreet sought rest, leading to his omission.

title: Brutal selloff! Gold, silver prices crash in volatile session - whatâ€™s causing the dip?
content: After an exhilarating rally in the recent sessions, gold and silver futures took a nosedive on Friday as traders took the opportunity to cash in on their gains. The drop, spurred by a robust US dollar and shifting global market sentiments, led to notable declines across both domestic and international exchanges.

title: 'From 0 to 64 lakh': Shah attacks Cong over infiltrators in poll-bound Assam
content: Union home minister Amit Shah accused the Congress of altering Assam's demography, claiming infiltrator numbers rose significantly during their rule. He urged voters to elect the BJP for a third term to combat infiltration and protect the state's identity, highlighting the Mising community's role in this effort.

title: â€˜Pakistani-yo ki choti choti khushiyaâ€™: Jadeja's sharp dig at Pakistan PM's X post
content: Former cricketer Ajay Jadeja sparked a debate by criticising Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif's celebratory tweet after Pakistan's T20I win against Australia. Jadeja's remark highlighted the perceived over-celebration of a bilateral series opener.

title: Sources: Cunningham set to become Falcons' GM
content: the Atlanta Falcons hired former assistant general manager Ian Cunningham as their new GM . the 40-year-old joins president of football Matt Ryan and coach Kevin Stefanski . "his vision for our team aligned exactly with the type of leader we were seeking to help take the Falcons to the next level," Ryan says .

title: Lopez-Stevenson picks: Can power crack Shakur's de...
content: Teofimo Lopez will put his WBO junior welterweight title on the line against Shakur Stevenson at Madison Square Garden in new york . the former unified lightweight champion is the fourth defense of the belt he won with a unanimous decision over Josh Taylor .

title: Behind the scenes at Driveline: How the lab that g...

title: Eagles hire Packers QB coach Mannion as OC
content: the Eagles are hiring Sean Mannion as their offensive coordinator . the 33-year-old has coached for just two years, breaking in as an offensive assistant for the Green Bay Packers in 2024 . he was promoted to quarterbacks coach this past season .
